title: How to Make Double Decadence Chocolate Chip Brownies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350ºF or 180ºC.
steps.description: If you're using a dark coated pan, preheat your oven to 325ºF or 165ºC.

steps.headline: Prepare a 9 x 13 baking dish by coating it lightly with butter or cooking spray.
Beat together butter, sugar, eggs and vanilla on low speed until smooth.
Melt 1 cup (182g) of chocolate chips in a saucepan using very low heat or in the microwave.
Add the melted chocolate to your first 4 ingredients.
Add the flour, oats, baking powder and the remaining chocolate chips into the batter.
steps.description: Mix well until the batter is smooth. Add nuts to the batter if desired.

steps.headline: Spread your Double Decadence Chocolate Chip Brownie batter into the greased pan.
Bake brownies for 25 to 30 minutes or until they pull away from the sides of the pan.
Allow your brownies to cool completely.
Cut your decadent chocolate chip brownies into desired size bars.
Sprinkle the cooled brownies with powdered sugar if desired.

text: Preheat your oven to 350ºF or 180ºC. If you're using a dark coated pan, preheat your oven to 325ºF or 165ºC. Prepare a 9 x 13 baking dish by coating it lightly with butter or cooking spray.  Beat together butter, sugar, eggs and vanilla on low speed until smooth.  Melt 1 cup (182g) of chocolate chips in a saucepan using very low heat or in the microwave.  Add the melted chocolate to your first 4 ingredients.  Add the flour, oats, baking powder and the remaining chocolate chips into the batter. Mix well until the batter is smooth. Add nuts to the batter if desired. Spread your Double Decadence Chocolate Chip Brownie batter into the greased pan.  Bake brownies for 25 to 30 minutes or until they pull away from the sides of the pan.  Allow your brownies to cool completely.  Cut your decadent chocolate chip brownies into desired size bars.  Sprinkle the cooled brownies with powdered sugar if desired. Serve!
